title: Adventurous and interesting
review: Around 15kms from Mukteshwar town down hill it's a important tourist spot but for Young and healthy people because its   Not easy to trek ups and downs and narrow passages to reach the falls.. quite adventurous..we liked the raw beauty of the place with not much of development and no facility by the government.

title: Falls is good, trek to the falls is even better
review: Me and my husband been to the Bhalu Gaad falls in the month of October 2018. Falls is a small one, but there is the thrill for amateur trekkers like us. The trek path is not suited for elderly people and kids as you have cross springs three times and the last one you have to literally crawl! At the end the view of the falls is rewarding and in day hour one can swim in the lake below the falls. The guide told the depth of the lake is of 40 ft and there is a cave down the water; so lot of accidents happen every year as people take risks considering the smaller nature of the falls and the lake. Life jackets are available on hire. Please wear good walking shoes and carry drinking water and some snacks as there is no arrangements and you will feel hungry after the trek and swim. Guides are from local village and are very friendly and not greedy. standard cost is per head Rs 150/- against the receipt . Though we have been charged Rs 50 additional for maintenance of the road. Memorable experience.

title: Beautiful
review: 1.2km trek with ups n down.not suitable for kids n person who is not comfortable with rough trekking.

title: Hidden treasure in Mukteshwar
review: Ideal for day treks, Bhalu Gaad is a hidden treasure in Mukteshwar, which shouldn't be missed. Best attraction in Mukteshwar. Around 1200 meter trek from the road to the fall which might be a challenge for old people

title: Cool like
review: The waterfall will happy and it gives more relaxed feeling when  see this waterfall my thinking will not complete changed

title: A decent place
review: a decent place but dhakuna waterfall was more heavy and good place , i would certainly suggest to go for dhakuna than bhalu gaad

title: Bhalugaad great trek
review: we travelled in April, water levels were relatively low. we have to croos two rivers through this 2 km trek. during the monsoon, it is quite impossible to cross these rivers. had to clamber down a steep rock to reach the waterfall. lovely trek and beutiful place

title: Waterfall
review: Well every hill station has waterfall. So as Mukteshwar. A good spot to capture pictures. Soothing and clam.

title: Pathetic
review: This is clearly over rated. The path to the waterfalls is for very fit people who expect to see a great sight after having walked and trekked quite a bit. Guarantee they will be dissatisfied once they reach. The falls are quite small and have dirty surroundings. Avoid.

title: Worth the walk
review: It may take you 20 to 50 minutes to reach depending on how you walk.

title: A short trek to the tiny waterfall in a deserted location!
review: My friend and I visited this waterfalls in February and found only a little water. But we enjoyed the 10 plus the drive through the curvy road to the Picturesque down hill valley and also the short trek (a bit adventurous too!) to the waterfalls.

title: For the adventurer in you...
review: I haven't visited much waterfalls before (only a couple of them in Kerala), indeed this was my first trip to Uttarakhand. 'Awesome' is the least word that could describe this water fall. The journey to the fall is no lesser beautiful than the destination. We went there in the month of September. There was good amount of water in the fall and the stream. The trek will take around 45 minutes, you will need to cross the stream at least twice. The best part is there is no rush, this place is in fact, mostly untouched, possibly because no one is gonna suggest you to take your family there (and your Gf as well, but we did see some girls over there, adventurous they must have been). You will see huge boulders in the path. No shop, nothing. Great place to visit. would like to visit again.

title: Heaven on Earth
review: Its a small hike that ends into a splendid waterfall. You can take a guide. Wud recommend that. During the hike u see amazing trees, rivers and the constant sound of gushing river is just so amazing. In the middle of the forest u are on ur journey to discover a beautiful waterfall. Do not think of diving. Its risky.

title: Go post monsson
review: Good to go small hike but after monsoon . You have to cross small 3 streams and then u are at the main waterfall. There is one more fall behind the second stream

title: Two Waterfall (Do Wear Life Jackets)
review: it is a hidden treasure in Mukteshwar, which should not be missed. It is just 30min walking away from the property. This walk up to the 50ft long waterfall itself is an experience as it takes you through dense forests and water streams. It’s also a paradise for naturist and bird watchers.

title: beautiful waterfalls
review: stunning falls, 40 feet and just mesmerizing.

title: Small and big waterfall.
review: There are two waterfalls . The first one is small in comparison to the second one . But the first one is less riskier.

title: Hidden beauty
review: Locate at the short drive from city centre. There are 2 waterfalls

title: worth visit
review: Not advisable for old age persons,but if you are young will enjoy a lot.bathing climbing anb scenic beauty every thing is here

title: Not a gr8 experience.
review: Its an hours trek from the main road to the actual waterfall.However, if your are confident and can bring your car down towards the waterfall by 0.5 kms, your trek remains to only 0.5 km. Do wear proper sports shoes and check your stamina levels before you start off.

title: Exploring
review: Though the time we went there, was very less water in the waterfall and the river bed ... Still we enjoyed the tracks we took to reach the very end till waterfall. The surroundings, the feeling and whole experience was amazing.

title: Over rated
review: A small waterfall. Considering there is nothing much to do in quaint Mukteshwar, it is ok to visit this waterfall. A bit of trekking is required to reach the waterfall. Disabled and elderly would not be able to trek.

title: Nature in it’s full splendour
review: Awesome trek for nearly 1.5 kms .........totally natural & in its raw form with beautiful views of Valleys , streams & Jungles .......though for a few family members it was an arduous task to trek to falls but the trek was worth it .........the Waterfall is so majestic & spellbinding .......it was so surreal ........a hidden treasure & a Must Visit attraction

title: Unforgeable experience
review: The track to reach waterfalls goes in between a Jungle. One has to cross 2-3 small symbolic rivers to reach there.  Be careful, on narrow paths as its slippery and condition of path is not good. Avoid slippers, have sports shoes as there are lots of small insects on the way.

title: Amazing waterfall
review: Must go. On the way to Bhimtal while coming back from Mukteshwar. Rocky path to reach to waterfall through the jungle with unforgettable experience.

title: Wow Water Falls
review: The waterfall is located in a very beautiful place , full of adventure , Rocky Path , and full on Masti.  My pet Cooper enjoyed alot in  the river, and one snake is sitting very peacefully . Overall A great place where Nature is untouched by Humans  Must Must Go

title: Worth the walk
review: The waterfall is around a 45 min trek from the drop-off location. Would suggest hiring a guide as the path is raw and you would need to cross two streams to reach the fall.

title: Woodland waterfall is very similar to Bhalu Gaad waterfall
review: This waterfall is quite natural and good for tourist to explore nature view in the Nainital region. Place is worth to visit.

title: Only adventure place in Mukteshwar.
review: You have to trek for 2-2.5 km to reach there. Trekking is interesting with some river crossing points, narrow ways, and Maggi points. After trekking, you will see a very small waterfall but with some interesting elements like one guy provide you with the life jacket on rent. You can go into the waterfall and jump from a big rock (Approx 10 Feet) into the water.

title: A small Trek and an Amazing Falls
review: A small trek along the stream to this beautiful falls will take 40 mins to an hour to reach. The trek is a bit hectic but what you see at the end is quite, pristine and amazing. Perhaps it would be only you when you reach there. The water is ice cold and is crystal clear. I must visit place I would say.

title: Not much water
review: Being winter month, there was not ennough water to enjoy the water fall. Visit if you have spare time.

title: Nice and quite easy to acces waterfalls
review: Around 45 minutes to access from the car parking, no need of any guide if you are a bit adventurous. The last down rocks climb is a bit hazardous. It's advisable to come with a good pair of trainers with good grip.

title: Trekking tales
review: The  actual waterfall sight is quite good. But to reach there without a guide is a bit difficult. Guide service is way too costly Rs. 350/- for half an hour trek.

title: Trekking and waterfalls - great combo at Mukteshwar .
review: Abt 2 hrs adventure with reasonable views , great feel of Bhalu Garh water fall must go place in Mukteshwar . Liked the trail and feel of fresh water at the end of abt 1.5 kms trek .

title: Try in monsoons
review: This waterfall is almost an hour's trek from the main road. Though trek is not that tiring or difficult.

title: Check your stamina, visit the waterfall.
review: I would definitely recommend the waterfall, but then you need to have the stamina to reach there. Wear nice sports shoes, with nice grips, would suggest taking a stick along and also keep some first aid handy. If the kids are small not recommended, till you are adventurous by nature. But the view is amazing.

title: Bhalugaad waterfall
review: Heavenly place, paradise on earth. Trek to waterfall is one of the best aspects . It's like hidden planet.

title: Beautifully Mesmerizing
review: Its a kind of jungle track to reach to this waterfall. Lovely place to enjoy the beauty of nature.

title: Good Trek but waterfall is sad
review: The trek to the waterfall is good. It goes thru the forest, you might not see people for few 100 meters, that makes it more adventurous. There are route signs but could be missed easily. One can experience small Apple orchards in between while dining. Walk closer to waterfall requires walking on a narrow oath followed by a small rock climbing. But the waterfall is in sad state. We could see the havoc created by plastic use. There were plastic bottles, beer cans in the pond, Fall was very thin due to lack of rain.

title: Hidden waterfalls
review: This waterfall is very nice but most of the people don't know about this place. So they miss this place to visit. It is very nice and quiet location. So if you want to take some rest in the nature, you must visit the place.

title: Hidden beauty !!
review: Visited this place in May 2017, not many people know about this place. Moderate trek of about 1.2 km, rocky terrain doesn't help though. You will have to climb few rocks to reach the actual pond. Nice place to spend few hours, good roads connecting it to mukteshwar. Must visit if you are travelling to mukteshwar

title: Nice
review: though it will give you little exercise to reach there but the moment you see it you will forget every thing

title: Deep in the forest
review: Reaching this waterfall requires a trek of ~1.5kms into the forest which includes crossing small streams thrice, so one has to be a little careful when travelling with elders and children. Also, the falls are located ~10kms from main Mukteshwar area and must be visited during daytime because it starts getting dark around 5pm. Even after crossing the 3 streams, few more steep rocks have to be crossed to ultimately reach the falls which is a tiresome task in itself. Various varieties of birds can also be seen here, so worth a visit if time permits.

title: A secluded hidden treasure amidst the woods
review: If you are looking for waterfall and nice little trek to a place less commercialised. This is it.

title: A nice place to visit if you want quiet place
review: We were on a trip to Mukteshwar for 3 days so we spent almost a day at these falls. If you want to go to the falls on your own, you cannot reach there as there is a trek for about 1.3 kms which you will not be able to find.

title: good track and nice fall
review: Neither crowded nor commercialised. place is still not much visited which makes it raw and still beautiful. we could clearly see rainbow in waterfall due to sunlight directly walling on it. it was quite a track and worthwhie views at end

title: a mini kempty fall in Mukhteshwar
review: its a beautiful place after a 1 km jungle trekk...the water is good .Its does decrease a lil during summers and is over laden in rains but most of the year its well watered....a very filmy location

title: Surprisingly beautiful
review: Must visit but you need to trek for almost 30 to 40 minutes. One of the few waterfall with lovely pond and one can actually go close to the fall, even one can bathe.

title: Highlight of our trip to Mukteshwar
review: We visited Bhalu Gaad waterfalls in September'17. While we were finding our way to this waterfall, we happened to meet Madan Ji who turned out to be a guide. He took us to the waterfall. The trek to this spot is very fun and adventurous. Madan Ji made our experience even better. He made sure all of us were comfortable during the trek. He even carried our bags by himself. When you reach the waterfall, it looks breathtakingly beautiful and straight out of some movie! When we reached there, we were the only ones there and it felt surreal.

title: Adventurous short trek. Must visit
review: Short trek around 1.5 km leads to this beautiful waterfall.Last 100 metres slightly difficult for elderly.In september being off season there were no tourist when we visited this place.Had we not been accompanied by a local guide ( mr mohan , ph no 8006021301) we would not have dared to go inside the forest path. The fall is beautiful . It was a great experience.Must do it.

title: Great Picnic place
review: While returning from Mukteshwar Dham, one should track for 4-5 Km and reach this fall for halt. Even in summer time the water is chilled.  Great fun in swimming thru it and standing under the fall. If you love to dare, take a jump from 15 feet tall rock near the fall into water. Must have your life jackets before attempting anything of this sort. Must go in groups. Cary own snacks and cold drink as there is no shop or place to buy.

title: Beautiful place
review: It's a longgggg trek.... but worth it! The waterfall is beautiful and all you want to do is sit and enjoy the nature's beauty...

title: Excellent offbeat spot
review: The trek to the waterfall takes almost an hour and all the way through one will enjoy being in the abode of nature. The grade of trek is fairly easy.

title: Newly discovered waterfall
review: Even unknown to localites. Must visit. Take a guide in Rs 200/-  and explore the place. Beautiful,serene,calm,quite, away from hussle bussle of city.

title: waterfalls
review: bhalu gaad waterfalls very close to cottage ananda water falls is very big and beautiful full day enjoy in bhalu gaad

title: Beautiful View
review: Lovely place to visit. You can reach here by jungle trekk. You can get down in the water, however, water is chilled cold throughout the year. But, you would definitely have a great experience.

title: This waterfall is serene, calm and stunning!
review: Bhalu Gaad falls can be reached after a 2km trek. The waterfall is yet not extremely crowded due to tourists unlike other major waterfalls. If you go here please travel responsibly and don't throw packets, bottles and cigarette butts in the the surrounding.

title: Amazing and Serene
review: This waterfall took our breath away. It is of medium height but very beautiful. The water makes crystal clear pond underneath perfect for bathing in summer.

title: Nice surprise package during Mukteshwar trip
review: Mukteshwar is for relaxation as there is little to do besides mandir visit( which is exotic) and Chauli ki jaali. But the hotel guy told us about this waterfall, about 10-15 kms from Mukteshwar. It's good if you like trekking. The trekking requires one to go through the jungle and shaded path so that's a respite. Last 100 meters are tricky but not difficult. There is a sense of accomplishment once you reach here but don't explore the waterfall, as locals told its 20-25 feet deep, while it looks unassuming.. overall good trek for digesting your meals..

title: Let's so hiking
review: This is one amazing trail. we went for this walk at around 2pm, after lunch. The trees provide the shade that is required to walk here. The terrain is not that tough , but people who aren used to walking and old people may need assistance. One must not confuse the first water fall on the trail for the actual waterfall. The actual waterfall is beyond a plantation of crops. There is a tea stall at the main waterfall that serves tea and maggie. After walking for so long the dipping ones feet in the cool water is an amazing feeling.

title: Good for trekking
review: You have to walk for more than 1.5kms one side and at one point its very difficult to go up and down

title: A must visit place in Nainital
review: I have visited this waterfall on 20th of July 2017. This is a good place which you can see after taking a ticket of Rs. 15/- per head. In front of waterfall there is a Restaurant operated by an ex-serviceman. You can take breakfast as well as lunch here. The charges are affordable and I recommend to eat here.

title: Beautiful hidden gem
review: A small yet beautiful waterfall. One needs to cross about 4 small streams and do a slight bit of trekking for approximately a kilometer from the parking.

title: Good trek
review: Very good trail....1.5 kms in total...A bit difficult towards the end....Be ready to wet ur clothes and shoes while crossing streams....At least 3 such crossings....Plunge pool swim a must at falls

title: Fun with adventure
review: Its a heavy rain day and rain just stops..We plan to go waterfall.. literally crossing the river thrice is to adventures..best to visit in mukteshwar

title: Good hike
review: Its a good hike, however the waterfall is an average one. The hike from the main road to the waterfall really gives you a good feel of the forest and trekking.

title: paisa vasool
review: first thing first u need to walk for good 30 min to reach with a very moderate climb down a  small rock wall

title: Nice hang out place
review: Just few minutes away from mukteshver near fruit orchards offer too good tracking field up to the fall and water fall itself is amazing best thing is you can dip in water for fun do remember you need to where proper tracking dress and shoes to be comfortable on this track it takes 3o min each way and if you have kids along take guide from outside for rs 250 he will be helpful to take to the fall and holding kids in bit dangerous places

title: Combine Trek & Waterfall bath
review: This is little difficult trail to trek but absolutely delightful. One crosses the water body 5-6 times to reach the fall. Going up and down in the hills, getting wet and then a bath in fresh water. It is blissful.

title: Nice, Quiet, Clear Water
review: A little hike in the forest and you reach Bhalu Gaad, absolutely clean waters here. Don't go here if you cannot walk in the jungle for 20 min. So I recommend only fit people to go here.

title: Good timepass
review: It was a good timepass and  we liked the trekking a lot. But its just a public place without having any guard or controlling authority. A few groups were drinking liquor in the open and nobody was  there to stop them.

title: Hair raising adventure
review: Thoroughly enjoyed the adventurous walk upto the water fall. It had our children in full excitement as not only the path through the forest was Mesmerising but at times the slopes and climbs were testing yet enjoyable.. no need to worry though. Even my 70+ parents were able to overcome the obstacles. One only has to have the mojo.....the climdown to the waterfall in the end is the climax... The fall itself is serene and beautiful.... Just enjoy...

title: Summer vacation
review: Very nice tracking experience alongwith crossing fall 3 times. You ahve to climp 3 times on rocks to reach to the water fall. It was exciting.

title: An average place but must go there is you like jungle trail/waterfall - take a guide
review: Went there with friends and young kids. It was a long walk. There was not much water and most part of it was dirty but given that we all were water babies, we continued. It was an adventurous walk in the nature and the little fall did not disappoint us. Good if you take a guide who will keep telling you about the flora making your walk interesting. Overall we enjoyed being there in the quiet place as there us nobody except our group. Ask a local about 'bicchu-plant' and dont touch it - it gives you an electric shock like sensation which lasts for almost a day.

title: A nice walk in d forest area
review: It was a enjoyable walk to this water fall. It took us 45 minutes to reach their. All of us enjoyed it. We recommend it but be careful if you are traveling with too small kids or infants.

title: Nature Escape
review: One of those places where you find yourself one with nature. Go with your loved ones, discussing philosophy amid the natural Wildlife calls and anticipate the unexpected. You will come out joyous  after the dip in chilled waters from the fall and a feeling of Nirvana.

title: Trek n Visit
review: After a 20-30 mins trek ,reached the place. Just 50 mts before the fall is a dangerous steep climb down ward. Saw 2-3 guys slip n hurt themself while coming up at this point. But that what the adventure is all about. Do take your towel n costume and enjoy the bath at the fall.

title: MUKTESHWAR's SAVING GRACE
review: This waterfall is nested inside 1.2km of hills and it is an easy track offering some resistance in last 100 meters. Water is clear and you can laze around the stream on a sunny day.

title: Surprisingly beautiful
review: Didn't expect this waterfall in the mid of rocky mountains. Just hire a bike/ your own vehicle, ask for Bhalu gaad (14 kms downhill from mukteshwar) and park near the entrance (no board-may skip if not asked). One needs to walk 1.2 km (in the forest rocky path) to reach here. Better to give Rs.100-200/- to a local boy who will guide you to this place, as there are few turns which will take you to some other place. At the end, its really and surprisingly good waterfall (ask if water there). The whole area looks surprisingly inviting and peaceful. One can go and sit for hours here. Recommended

title: A short but scenic trek
review: It is a gem of a place. The waterfall is beautiful but the trek to reach the waterfall is even better. Beautiful & Scenic. Much recommended.

title: Nice little trek to reach the fall
review: If you are looking for water fall and nice little trek to a place less commercialised. This is it. Need to be a bit fitter to enjoy the trek... Will take around 30 min to reach the place by foot... Trekking up and down...

title: This place is an excellent trekking site, with crystal clear water
review: This place is an excellent trekking site, with crystal clear water. I do know the trekking is not for everyone. And ofcourse you can't go there at night. The trek is through a jungle and no streetlights there.

title: pleasing and southing
review: The view of waterfall was actually pleasing and southing, you can easily spend 2-3 hours siting and talking.

title: wonderful
review: a bit tough but worth going in !!

title: Nice place to visit
review: One should definitely try this place and ensure to carry your swimming costumes. The whole track is through jungle and mountains so be ready for some exercise of muscles.

title: Bhalu fall
review: Beautiful place to visit when in Mukteshwar, close to nature where you can feel relaxed and enjoy the beauty of the the creator.

title: Place is nice but reaching is tough
review: This place is very difficult to reach especially if you have kids or older people in the group. If you are not comfortable walking in Jungle then there are local guides available for 300 rupees for 3-4 hours. In the Jungle there are 2-3 small restaurants

title: Must Visit
review: Wow the approach is awesome and adventurous. The shower in cold water is refreshing but again the bloody Maggi joints at even these remote locations are a big turn offs

title: Mesmerising
review: Nice place to be.

title: Great trek!
review: Exciting trek.. Can be done with kids. Be mindful of the right footwear since rocks are sharp at some places.. This is a must do trek with families in mukhteshwar

title: Highlight of Mukteshwar trip
review: Two waterfalls, 3km up-down trek and it is the best way to connect with nature. It is a bit difficult trek and you need a guide for sure.

title: Perfect place in wilderness
review: It's a perfect place to spend the day amidst rocky path, thick green spread and the waterfall. You are in awe and feel scary what if a bear or Bhalu lands in front of you and offers a selfie moment. It's a must visit preferably with a local guide as you are likely to be lost through the narrow path. The delight can be manifold if you choose to spend hours gazing through the birds play,beautiful shades of light, the music of waterfall. A secluded treasure hidden from public eyes.

title: Chamm chamm cham
review: My bestest experience of the trip was at this place...thrilling and unexpected place to b in mukteshwar...cool breeze and chillef water of this waterfall was one of my lifetime experience

title: Beautiful & a must Visit Trek
review: Its a beautiful and must visit trek on the way to Mukteshwar, the falls at the end of the trek is worth the whole walk. Little tough but very scenic. Best for nature lovers.

title: Serene
review: Lovely trek of about one and a half kms.. away from the commercialised world.. few people.. lovely sound of water falling..

title: Hidden Gem
review: A very serene location about 1.5 kms easy trek from the nearest road.

title: amazing
review: amazing place to visit, 1.5 km trek in nature (different mountains) gives you an next level of excitement when you reach there

title: Must Visit
review: it was an awesome trek before we could see this beautiful waterfall.. Its a must visit if you around Mukteshwar.. Trek is worth enough for this waterfall..

title: Nice liitle gem
review: This water fall can be reached by just a 1.0 - 1.5 km trek which is pretty easy except a couple of rocks that need to be climbed right at end of the trek which might be a challenge of elderly. It's a small waterfall and can be a nice picnic spot for spending a couple of hours

title: Amazing waterfall in the middle of mountain forests
review: It is very good place for tracking. The waterfall is located right in the middle of a mountain area with lush green forest. Throughout the entire trail the atmosphere was very quiet, gentle, and green. We could here chirping of birds. At many places during tracking we enjoyed cool and gentle breeze. It usually takes around 20-25 minutes of walk from road to the waterfall, but you do not really have rush. You can walk slowly and enjoy the trail.

title: Beautiful falls.
review: In the middle of wilderness there is a 60 feet waterfall which can also double up as a picnic place.

title: Bhalu Ghaat - a secret little waterfall @ Mukteshwar
review: This used to be little secret as I used to call it back in 2012.

title: Bhalu Gaad waterfalls
review: Bhalugaad waterfall is located inside the deep forest.Its located about 4 kms from Kasialekh,Mukteshwar.You can reach up to a distance by road and after parking your vehicle,there is a walk of about 30 minutes.Beautiful walk next to the river bed leads you to this majestic 60 feet high and secluded waterfall located in a dense forest.

title: Beautiful Waterfall!!!
review: This place is find of the hotels association at Mukteshwar. It is a beautiful waterfall. Since it has been recently opened for tourism, it is absolutely clean and serene. One needs to trek for about half an hour to get here and the trek through the jungle is quite interesting. A must visit place!

title: Nice waterfall to visit
review: Bhalu gaad waterfall is a 1200 meter trek from the road to the fall. Simple & easy trek except the last few slippery rocks that need to be climbed up and down carefully, which might be a challenge for elderly people. The 60 feet high waterfall is a pleasant picnic spot.

title: Bhalu Gaad waterfall ...keep walking till you get this treasure
review: Bhalu means Good in garhwali and Gaad means river  is a small natural waterfall. One has to trek around 2 kms to reach there through a dense green forest. The trek is a good one and also brings you close to nature.

title: Its a name sake waterfall but accessibility is not good
review: Though its a waterfall but not that worth it.

title: Very nice trekk and surprise in the end
review: Shorr and extremely amazing trekk. You have to cross same river 3 times in a short trek of about 40 mimutes. We did that in heavy rains. There is a tea stall at the start; do take a guide from there. They have friendly people and they know their business well. Do take a small detour ti another waterfall where you can till the end. Must to do if you are in mukteshwar. Bargain with the guide and you would get it anywhere above 200. But i am sure with the excellent seevice they provide;  you would end up in paying them well. Cheerz!!

title: Best natural fall and tracking destination
review: It was amazing track of about 2-3 Kms worth going there, small water fall as since last nine month this area has not seen rains still it's natural water fall still has life, water was clear as crystal ,deep inside Vally but not a difficult track,i was not very sure but a young boy to whom we hired as guide kept me motivating ,and I m delighted that I went there ......best place in mukteshwar .

title: unexplored waterfall right in lap of nature
review: The way is very tricky, we took a local kid to visit this place. It took us 30-45 min to reach the place. The track is raw, exciting, difficult to negotiate n few places, do wear sturdy shoes. Final destination is good but do not expect too much.

title: might be good in monsoon
review: its just another waterfall , can be spent around 1 hr over there . but will be definitely beautiful after rain

title: Fun trek. small waterfall.
review: The waterfall itself is average, though i enjoyed the 2 kms trek to it better. Not for kids and women.

title: Beautiful View
review: Wonderful journey from main road to the waterfall. Its risky but fun. I would suggest that only ones who have good stamina should go.

title: good trek...better exhilaration
review: walk to the falls was tiring. But one that makes you one with nature. As one climbed down to the bed of the rivulet... looking up and seeeing the roots of hte trees on the hill top was like a darshan of the matted locks of Shiva holding the Ganga.

title: Nothing is there
review: Nothing is there, no water, no rain... only adventurous walk..... which you cannot do with your family.

title: Short but exciting trek
review: It's a small but exciting trek that one should not miss if you are in Mukteshwar.  Ensure that it had rained as water may not be their during May, June. I was lucky to experience the fall. It's a small place and the crowd may put you down but you'll love it anyway.

title: Ideal for a base Dive and Trek
review: A small trek brings you to these beautiful but small water falls where you can enjoy a cool dip and dive from the falls.

title: Hidden treasure
review: This water fall has only recently been listed. it is a hidden treasure and loved by trekkers. Not frequented by many travelers, the place thus remains plastic free, neat and clean. It requires some 30 minutes walk in the mountains to reach the falls. Very good experience and a place for nature lovers. Water is clean and forest around the falls is lush green.

title: Natural Water Falls
review: A natural waterfall which is a short trek away from the main road. Named as such because of sightings of Bears (Bhalu). The pure natural water flows in a stream and the surrounding jungle makes it an ideal picnic spot.

title: The beautiful place
review: The waterfall are very beautiful to visit. There are two waterfalls. We enjoyed a lot at this place. it is a perfect place for having fun. There is trek to the waterfall, which is beautifully surrounded by the forest.The waterfalls are in Kaul, Pokrad, near Dhari close to Mukteshwar.

title: Waterfall
review: we were not aware about this water fall on the way we have seen some people there and asked what is there and when we visited it we realised that what we are going to miss. very beautiful and awesome

title: Best attraction in Mukteshwar
review: If you are visiting Mukteshwar, don't forget to visit Bhalu Gaad.

title: Bhalu Gaad Waterfall : Gem of Mukteshwar
review: Bhalu Gaad Waterfall is situated i mid of Mukteshwar forest . you can reach to this lonely and amazing place by trekking 2-3 Km.

title: An amazing waterfall with a rainbow inside it!
review: Amazing waterfall, though the last part of the trek was a little risky and difficult. You can actually see a rainbow right inside the waterfall!
